title: refactor(http): add HTTP status code classification macros
body:
## Summary
Replace magic HTTP status code numbers with descriptive classification macros.

## Problem
Magic numbers for HTTP status codes scattered throughout:
- Lines 1080, 1129-1130, 1147-1148, 1214, 2306
- Numbers: 200, 201, 300, 301, 302, 303, 307, 308, 401, 500, 599

Code like `if (status >= 200 && status < 300)` is less readable than `if (HTTP_STATUS_IS_SUCCESS(status))`.

## Location
- File: `src/http/SocketHTTPClient.c` (consumer)
- File: `include/http/SocketHTTP.h` (add macros here)

## Proposed Solution
Add to `include/http/SocketHTTP.h`:
```c
#define HTTP_STATUS_IS_INFORMATIONAL(c) ((c) >= 100 && (c) < 200)
#define HTTP_STATUS_IS_SUCCESS(c)       ((c) >= 200 && (c) < 300)
#define HTTP_STATUS_IS_REDIRECT(c)      ((c) >= 300 && (c) < 400)
#define HTTP_STATUS_IS_CLIENT_ERROR(c)  ((c) >= 400 && (c) < 500)
#define HTTP_STATUS_IS_SERVER_ERROR(c)  ((c) >= 500 && (c) < 600)
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Macros added to SocketHTTP.h
- [ ] SocketHTTPClient.c updated to use macros
- [ ] Other HTTP files checked for similar patterns
- [ ] Tests pass with sanitizers
- [ ] ~15 lines clarified/saved

## Labels
refactor, redundancy, http
